Not recommended.

content:
er 18, 2016
												So, this project started out as a 3D version of the successful game "Hooligansgame" made by a Polish company in Łódź, who were also known to release "Ultras Online" back in the day. The developers of THIS game wanted to piggyback off their success but became a sad attempt after all, starting out under the name of "Hooligan fighters", later "Hooligan Warriors" naturally the people expected the developers to add actual club insignia and perhaps an overworld. When the developers realized it was too much work, they gave up on the concept, made it a generic fighting game and renamed it "Street Warriors online", which already in itself tells you how much they care about their fanbased compared to how much they only care about a quick buck.While they did put some effort in motion tracking to make the fighting moves realistic and while the maps are beautifully designed I really, really urge you not to play this game due to the developer's crappy mentality that only goes after money, unwilling to listen to any feedback the users give them. Believe me, I gave them a shot, I tried to make them listen but to no avail. The fighting in itself is really generic, stale and requires no skills at all. And instead of doing something about it, the developers, yet again, fail to listen to constructive criticism and instead make a salty post on Facebook simply calling everyone a hater and begging people for thumbs up.

content:
er 19, 2016
												This game is what happens when you try to make an online fighting game but forget to make it goodPROS+Always lots of people to play with+Decent amount of fighter cusomizationCONS-Combat is very basic and has very little strategy-Melee weapon attacks can be spammed and take away most of your health-Secondary currency-Pay to win-Frequent game breaking glitches-Fighter will often face the wrong way when you attempt to blockDont waste your time with this game. It may be improved in the future but for now, avoid it.OVERALL: 4/10
